title: 110_hr3865
content: The Act titled "Home Health Care Access Protection Act of 2007" aims to protect access to Medicare home health services. The Home Health Care Access Protection Act of 2007 amends Section 1895(b)(3) of the Social Security Act to include processes and criteria for evaluating changes in case mix for home health services payment. The Home Health Care Access Protection Act of 2007 amends Section 1895(b)(3) of the Social Security Act to include processes for developing standards with input from stakeholders representing various interests in home health care. The Home Health Care Access Protection Act of 2007 amends Section 1895(b)(3) of the Social Security Act to establish standards with input from professionals to distinguish real changes in case mix from coding or classification changes. The Technical Advisory Group will review and comment on proposed rulemaking by the Secretary. The Secretary must establish standards to differentiate case mix changes from coding changes. If an outside contractor is involved, they must not have been part of designing the case mix adjustment factors. Any increase in case mix must be determined by the Secretary. The Secretary must establish standards to differentiate case mix changes from coding changes and evaluate any increase in case mix through actual review of claims and services without using proxies or surrogates. The standards must be established by regulation. The Secretary must establish standards for differentiating case mix changes from coding changes and evaluating any increase in case mix through actual review of claims and services without using proxies or surrogates. The criteria for these standards include the impact of changes in the program under this title on individuals receiving home health services. The curr_chunk discusses the impact of changes in the provision of health care services by providers other than home health agencies, distinctions in individuals initiating home health services from different care settings, and the effect of coding changes on annual expenditures. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will not implement case mix adjustments for home health services under the prospective payment system to account for coding changes unrelated to patient health. The Secretary will republish rates to adjust for coding changes not related to patient health status and will only make adjustments in compliance with specified sections.
